      • getAvailableTables

        public java.util.ArrayList<Table> getAvailableTables()
        Shorthand to fetch tables with AVAILABLE Table.Status. Use getUsableTables() to include tables that have expired Reservations.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of AVAILABLE tables
        See Also:
        getUsableTables()

          public java.util.ArrayList<Table> getReservedTables()
          Shorthand to fetch tables with RESERVED Table.Status.
          Returns:
          ArrayList
        of RESERVED tables

        • getUsableTables

          private java.util.ArrayList<Table> getUsableTables()
          Gets ArrayList of Tables that have the AVAILABLE Table.Status. This method will have the side-effect of updating the status of table Reservations that have expired. These expired tables will be set to AVAILABLE status and included in the returned list of usable tables. To list available tables, without side-effects, use getAvailableTables()
          Returns:
          an ArrayList
        of Tables with AVAILABLE status
        See Also:
        getAvailableTables()

        • findUsableTable

          private Table findUsableTable​(int minimumCapacity)
          Internal algorithm for finding smallest suitable table.
          Parameters:
          minimumCapacity - Capacity of the found table will be at least this big
          Returns:
          Smallest usable Table, or null if not found

        • allocateReservation

          public int allocateReservation​(Reservation reservation)
          Used by ReservationManager to assign Reservations to Tables. This will try to find a suitable table based on the numPax of the given Reservation. If a table is found, then its Table.Status and expiry will be updated. Prints a warning if no suitable table is found.
          Parameters:
          reservation - The Reservation object to assign.
          Returns:
          tableId of the Table allocated to the given Reservation
